intro: Deinbollia nyasica, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, forested areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
